title: How to Make Vanilla Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350F and collect all of the necessary ingredients.
steps.description: If you do not have butter, margarine can be used as a substitute instead. If you substitute with margarine, the milk will not be needed.

steps.headline: Mix flour, baking soda and salt into a bowl.
Combine softened butter and sugar in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Typically it is easier to put sugar in the bowl first and then add the butter. This prevents the ingredients from clumping together.

steps.headline: Add a cracked egg and vanilla to the bowl with softened butter and sugar.
Beat the ingredients in the second bowl well with a mixer, slowly add in the ingredients from the first bowl while mixing.
steps.description: Beat until a white, creamy consistency forms.

steps.headline: Stir half of the cup of finely chopped nuts into the batter.
steps.description: This can be done by hand, with a spatula or once again with the mixer.

steps.headline: Smooth the batter in the pan, until even in all locations.
steps.description: Sprinkle the other half cup of the nuts on top of the batter.

steps.headline: Bake at 350F for 20-25 minutes.
steps.description: To check if your brownies are done baking, take a toothpick and stick it directly into the brownies and then pull directly out. If It comes out clean, they're done. If it comes out with clumps of batter on it, they need to keep on cooking. Keep checking every 2-3 minutes until they are done.

steps.headline: Take them out of the oven and let them cool.

text: Preheat the oven to 350F and collect all of the necessary ingredients. If you do not have butter, margarine can be used as a substitute instead. If you substitute with margarine, the milk will not be needed. Mix flour, baking soda and salt into a bowl.  Combine softened butter and sugar in a separate bowl. Typically it is easier to put sugar in the bowl first and then add the butter. This prevents the ingredients from clumping together. Add a cracked egg and vanilla to the bowl with softened butter and sugar.  Beat the ingredients in the second bowl well with a mixer, slowly add in the ingredients from the first bowl while mixing. Beat until a white, creamy consistency forms. Stir half of the cup of finely chopped nuts into the batter. This can be done by hand, with a spatula or once again with the mixer. Pour into a greased 8"x8"x2" pan.  Smooth the batter in the pan, until even in all locations. Sprinkle the other half cup of the nuts on top of the batter. Bake at 350F for 20-25 minutes. To check if your brownies are done baking, take a toothpick and stick it directly into the brownies and then pull directly out. If It comes out clean, they're done. If it comes out with clumps of batter on it, they need to keep on cooking. Keep checking every 2-3 minutes until they are done. Take them out of the oven and let them cool.  Cut into squares and serve. Enjoy!
